chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
items.plainText: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

items.text: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
items.plainText: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

items.text: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
items.plainText: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

items.text: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
items.plainText: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

items.text: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
items.plainText: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

items.text: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.
items.plainText: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

items.text: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
items.plainText: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

items.text: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
items.plainText: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

items.text: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;
items.plainText: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;

items.text: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
items.plainText: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

items.text: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
items.plainText: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

items.text: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
items.plainText: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

items.text: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
items.plainText: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

items.text: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
items.plainText: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

items.text: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
items.plainText: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

items.text: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
items.plainText: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

items.text: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
items.plainText: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

items.text: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)
items.plainText: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)

items.text: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
items.plainText: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

items.text: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
items.plainText: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

items.text: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
items.plainText: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

items.text: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
items.plainText: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

items.text: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
items.plainText: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

items.text: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
items.plainText: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

items.text: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
items.plainText: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

items.text: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
items.plainText: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

items.text: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
items.plainText: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

items.text: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
items.plainText: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

items.text: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
items.plainText: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

items.text: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
items.plainText: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

items.text: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
items.plainText: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

items.text: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
items.plainText: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.

items.text: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
items.plainText: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

items.text: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
items.plainText: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

items.text: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
items.plainText: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

items.text: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
items.plainText: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

items.text: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
items.plainText: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

items.text: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
items.plainText: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

items.text: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
items.plainText: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

items.text: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
items.plainText: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
